Art 4.16
Direct descendant line
Children or their descendants succeed their father and mother, grandparents or other ascendants, even if they do not have the same parents and regardless of how their filiation was established.
The succession is entrusted to the closest descendants in degree. They succeed by equal portions and by head, when they are all in the first degree and called in their own right. They succeed by stock, when all or some of them come by substitution.
